main event: A second-hand report of an unusual sighting near Greenville, Ohio on October 28, 1957, involving bright flashes in the sky.
interesting points: The observer described bright flashes that appeared around once every second., The sighting occurred on a rainy, cloudy evening., The observer initially thought the flashes might be from an airplane but later doubted this conclusion., The sighting lasted for approximately three minutes., A 16mm film was sent by the observer but was not retrieved for analysis.
witness description: the observer's chemistry colleague who used binoculars to observe the flashes
